input:
The following structures that can coexist in the same type of rocks are:
Choose from:

A. Stomatal, almond-shaped, thousand-piece
B. Plate-shaped, gneiss-shaped, pillow-shaped
C. Wave marks, mud cracks, parallel bedding

The most soluble of the following rocks are:
Choose from:

A. Limestone
B. Dolomite
C. Mudstone

The following materials are mainly formed by groundwater metasomatism:
Choose from:

A. Nodule
B. Sinter
C. Silicified Wood
D. Stone Salt Pseudocrystal

Among the following structures, the smallest displacement of geological body is:
Choose from:

A. Normal Fault
B. Reverse Fault
C. Translation Fault
D. Joint

The following geological ages are arranged from old to new as:
Choose from:

A. S-O-Z-T-P
B. Z-O-S-P-T
C. Z-S-O-T-P
D. S-Z-O-P-T

The following fully cleaved minerals are:
Choose from:

A. Quartz
B. Muscovite
C. Pyroxene

The sequence of various leases in the formation of sedimentary rocks is:
Choose from:

A. Weathering-transporting-denudation-sedimentary-diagenesis
B. Weathering-denudation-transporting-sedimentary-diagenesis
C. Denudation-weathering-transporting-sedimentary-diagenesis

Chemical weathering is most easily carried out at:
Choose from:

A. Cold and dry areas
B. Warm and humid areas
C. Arid areas

The plate-like intrusive rock mass formed by magma intrusion along the fault plane (zone) of surrounding rock is called:
Choose from:

A. Rock Plant
B. Rock Bed
C. Rock Wall

Most volcanoes on the Earth are located in:
Choose from:

A. Continental Rift Zone
B. Pacific Rim Zone
C. Alpine-Mediterranean-Himalayan Zone

The process in which the original rock is basically in solid state and is changed into another new rock mainly by internal dynamic geological process is called:
Choose from:

A. Magmatism
B. Weathering
C. Metamorphism

The main changes of limestone metamorphism into marble are:
Choose from:

A. Mineral composition
B. Rock color
C. Rock structure

River erosion mainly occurs in:
Choose from:

A. Downstream
B. Midstream
C. Upstream

The bedrock is formed by magma:
Choose from:

A. Ejection
B. Intrusion
C. Metasomatism

Root cleavage of plants belongs to:
Choose from:

A. Chemical weathering
B. Physical weathering
C. Biological weathering

The interface between crust and mantle is called:
Choose from:

A. Gutenberg
B. Conrad
C. Moho

Gabbro is:
Choose from:

A. Extrusive Rock
B. Intrusive Rock
C. Metamorphic Rock

Among the following rocks, the weakest resistance to chemical weathering is:
Choose from:

A. Granite
B. Limestone
C. Quartz Sandstone

Gymnosperms flourished in:
Choose from:

A. Paleozoic
B. Cenozoic
C. Cenozoic 29. Streaks were (color mineral powder
D. mineral surface

The morphology of amphibole is:
Choose from:

A. Flaky
B. Granular
C. Long columnar

Reptiles flourished in:
Choose from:

A. Paleozoic
B. Cenozoic
C. Mesozoic

In the Mohs hardness tester, the minerals with hardness grade 7 are:
Choose from:

A. Gypsum
B. Quartz
C. Topaz

Quiet volcanoes emit mainly:
Choose from:

A. Acid lava
B. Basic lava
C. Neutral lava

The main mineral compositions of gabbro are:
Choose from:

A. Hornblende and plagioclase
B. Pyroxene and plagioclase
C. Plagioclase and quartz

Glaciers:
Choose from:

A. Have sorting function
B. Have rounding function
C. Have no sorting function' in the process of detritus transportation

The half order of lake chemical deposition in arid climate region is:
Choose from:

A. Sulfate-chloride-carbonate
B. Chloride-sulfate-carbonate
C. Carbonate-sulfate-chloride

In which period did human, true images and real horses appear:
Choose from:

A. J
B. K
C. T
D. Q

Indosinian movement occurred in the period of:
Choose from:

A. Carboniferous
B. Permian
C. Triassic
D. Cretaceous

The skarn type deposit was formed by which of the following metamorphism:
Choose from:

A. Contact metasomatic metamorphism
B. Regional metamorphism
C. Burial metamorphism
D. Dynamic metamorphism

Caledonian movement occurs in:
Choose from:

A. Mesozoic
B. Late Paleozoic
C. Early Paleozoic
D. Cenozoic

Which of the following fold structures must have undergone stratigraphic inversion:
Choose from:

A. Tilting fold
B. Vertical fold
C. Inclined fold
D. Rolling fold

In a nappe structure, if the younger rock block is exposed in the older rock block due to strong erosion, the structure is called:
Choose from:

A. Klippe
B. Structural window
C. Overthrust fault
D. Thrust fault

Sheet structure is a common structure in regional metamorphic rocks. Which of the following is the most metamorphic structure:
Choose from:

A. Plate structure
B. Thousand-piece structure
C. Sheet structure
D. Strong gneiss

According to isotopic dating, the longest geological period is:
Choose from:

A. Proterozoic
B. Paleozoic
C. Mesozoic
D. Cenozoic

If trilobites are found in the strata, then the stratigraphic age is:
Choose from:

A. Early Ordovician
B. Tertiary
C. Cretaceous
D. Early Cambrian

Which sedimentary formation reflects the transformation from marine facies to continental facies:
Choose from:

A. flysch deposition
B. turbidity current deposition
C. molasite deposition
D. pyroclastic deposition

Which part of the earth belongs between Gutenberg surface and Moho surface:
Choose from:

A. Upper crust
B. Lower crust
C. Mantle
D. Core

Mesozoic gymnosperms have been unprecedented development, which of the following plant fossils do not belong to gymnosperms:
Choose from:

A. Big feather fern
B. Cycad
C. Pine and cypress
D. Ginkgo biloba

The boundary, system, series and order are:
Choose from:

A. Lithostratigraphic unit
C. Biological taxonomic unit
B. Time unit
D. Chronostratigraphic unit

What class does quartz belong to in Mohs hardness tester:
Choose from:

A. 5
B. 6
C. 7

Which of the following rocks belongs to dynamic metamorphic rocks:
Choose from:

A. Schist
B. Gneiss
C. Mylonite
D. Marble

Which of the following is a monoelemental mineral:
Choose from:

A. Quartz
B. Plagioclase
C. Biotite
D. Diamond

Fine-grained dikes belong to:
Choose from:

A. plutonic rocks
B. shallow rocks
C. sedimentary rocks
D. subvolcanic rocks

The unique mineral group formed by metamorphism is:
Choose from:

A. Olivine, pyroxene, hornblende, biotite
B. Andalusite, hornblende, kaolinite, magnetite
C. Sericite, andalusite, wollastonite, garnet
D. Pyroxene, kyanite, graphite, garnet

Streamline structure generally occurs in which of the following rock types:
Choose from:

A. Basalt
B. Andesite
C. Rhyolite
D. Trachyte

Basalt belongs to:
Choose from:

A. Ultrabasic rock
B. Basic rock
C. Acid rock
D. Neutral rock

The shape of the earth is:
Choose from:

A. Spherical
B. Ideal rotating ellipsoid
C. Apple shape
D. An approximately pear-shaped ellipsoid of revolution

The following units that do not belong to the continental surface form are:
Choose from:

A. Island arc
B. Hills
C. Rift Valley
D. Basin

In the following places, the greatest gravity of the earth is:
Choose from:

A. Equator
B. Antarctica
C. Tropic of Cancer
D. Beijing

Among the following areas, the area with the highest heat flow value is:
Choose from:

A. Continental area
B. Pacific
C. Atlantic
D. The Indian Ocean

What is closely related to human activities and geological processes in the atmosphere is:
Choose from:

A. Troposphere
B. Stratosphere
C. Middle layer
D. The warm layer

Among the following areas, the area with the smallest earthquake probability is:
Choose from:

A. Japan
B. Taiwan
C. Alaska
D. Guangzhou

Among the following silicate minerals, the most easily weathered is:
Choose from:

A. Quartz
B. Biotite
C. Olivine
D. Hornblende

Earthquakes distributed in the mid-ocean ridge are characterized by:
Choose from:

A. Shallow source and large magnitude
B. The source is deep and the magnitude is large
C. The source is shallow and the magnitude is small
D. The source is deep and the magnitude is small

The following phenomena that do not belong to groundwater sedimentation are:
Choose from:

A. Dropping stones in karst caves
B. Petrified wood
C. Sinter
D. Bottom-showing structure

The following are not minerals:
Choose from:

A. Ice
B. Quartz
C. Coal
D. Natural gold

Among the following minerals, the hardness is greater than that of quartz:
Choose from:

A. Topaz
B. Fluorite
C. Orthoclase
D. Calcite

Granite belongs to:
Choose from:

A. Acid plutonic intrusive rocks
B. Neutral epithermal intrusive rocks
C. Basic plutonic intrusive rocks
D. Basic epithermal intrusive rocks

Choose from:

A. Silty sandstone containing gravel
B. Gravel sandstone containing silt
C. Gravel siltstone
D. Silty conglomerate

Choose from:

A. Rising wave zone
B. Wave-breaking zone
C. Broken wave zone
D. Surfing belt

D. Chaoshangping

Choose from:

A. Cenozoic

C. Paleozoic
D. Proterozoic

A. graptolite
B. Coral
C. Semi-freshwater fish
D. Trilobites

C. Normal temperature layer
D. Inner thermal layer
